description: Create a CSV or Excel file from a collection of records
label: Export to CSV/XLSX

options.name: filter
options.label: Filter
options.info: Filter based on Data API filter with variable options.
Variables to be used in the filter option.
options.label: Variables
options.name: filterVariables

options.label: Delimiter
options.info: Set a delimiter for the CSV file.
options.name: delimiter
exportPropertyMapping
options.label: Property Mapping
options.info: KEY column = column name for the file, VALUE column = the database name (in snake_case) of the property. For belongs-to relations use the datebase name (in snake_case)

options.name: formatPropertyMapping
options.label: Format mapping for export columns (price and decimal (if you want to deviate from the default decimal notation,".") and date/time properties are currently supported)
options.info: KEY = export property mapping column name, VALUE = format of the property. Allowed format values: "Price", "Decimal", "Date", "Time", or "Datetime". The notation is as follows: "Decimal|,", i.e. "Decimal|," or "Date|<datefns format>", i.e. "Date|dd-MM-yyyy". The format behind the comma needs to be entered in accordance with the date-fns format (i.e. dd-MM-yyyy or MM/dd/yyyy etc), see https://date-fns.org/v2.16.1/docs/format

options.label: Use BOM
options.name: useBom
options.info: If true, adds a BOM character at the start of the CSV to improve file compatibility.
